subject: Re: Producing a diff report after comparing two junit results?
msgSnippet: I assume these reports are in files. Couldn t you just diff them (assuming your on a nice *nix system; I guess on Windows you need to resort to WinDiff) or

I assume these reports are in files. Couldn't you just 'diff' them (assumin=
g your on a nice *nix system; I guess on Windows you need to resort to WinD=
iff) or is there something I don't understand about the problem
   diff -bw=
 ReportA ReportB 
should do the trick.  You'll get differences between them=
 if the running times of tests are different but the serious differences sh=
ould be obvious.

Are you going to asses the differences visually or is thi=
s going to be in a script; if the latter, the problem is more interesting (=
i.e. harder).

Hope this helps

jim

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "rohitku=
lkarni15" <rohitkulkarni15@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> Currently, I have a req=
uirement of comparing results of two JUnit reports(with same set of tests).=

> The result of this comparison activity should be to generate a diff repo=
rt that mentions only those tests whose status is different as compared to =
the 1st result
> 
> i.e. If i have report A and report B, how to get the li=
st of differences between these two reports.
> 
> Can someone please guide =
me on how to do this?
> 
> Thanks,
> Rohit
>
